b:
Alexander The Great, known for his military conquest, was king for just 12 years. He succeeded his father and became king at the age of 20, and died at a young age of 32.

He was simultaneously the King of Macedonia, Pharaoh of Egypt, King of Persia, and King of Asia.

Pomegranate is amalgamation of words "pome" meaning Apple and "granum" meaning grains/seeds making Pomegranate, an apple with many seeds.

Pomegranate was also called Grenade in mid 16th century and the small bomb "hand grenade" was named so because of its resemblance to the fruit.

In many Israeli elementary schools, algebra is taught without the use of the symbol "+".

They use an ï¬© (inverted T) instead. The reason for this practice is that it avoids the writing of a symbol "+" that looks like a Christian cross.

Our universe will start repeating itself after 10^10^10^10^2.08 years - called PoincarÃ© recurrence time.

Our universe just like any other system could only exists in certain finite number of states, and once all of those states exhaust you are bound to see repetition.

Flag of Nepal is the most mathematical flag ever.

It takes 24 steps to draw and is the only non-quadrilateral country flag. Precise geometrical description of the flag is specified in Article 5 Schedule 1 of their constitution.

If you like geometry you are in for a treat.

Tilted axis of planet causes seasons.

Earth tilt ~23.5 deg hence 4 uniform seasons. Mercury, Venus, Jupiter, Neptune tilt has ~0 deg hence no seasons.

Uranus has a tilt of ~98 deg which means half the planet doesnâ€™t see sun for two 21 long earth-years seasons; while other half has continuous daylight.

From 16th to 19th century, transatlantic slave trade transported 10-12 million enslaved Africans, across the Atlantic Ocean to the Brazil, Caribbean and USA.

About 15% of them died during the journey, others became property and were bought and sold like any other commodity.

The word Philosophy comes from the Ancient Greek word philosophia, which meant "love of wisdom".

philos - "beloved / to love" + sophos - "wisdom"

No wonder it is the "mother of all sciences".

Why did the Pirates wear eyepatches?

Pirates didn't wear eyepatches because of a missing eye; it's much more likely that they were keeping one eye ready to see in darkness, so that they could adjust quickly when going below deck.

Why are flames shaped the way they are?

When flame burns, the surrounding heats and the air expands making it less dense. Gravity pulls colder denser air down and the hot air rises. This upward flow of air is what gives a flame its teardrop shape.

How Many Decimals of Pi Do We Really Need?

The answer is 39.

Taking Pi to 39 digits allows us to measure the circumference of the observable universe (2.76 x 10^24 km) to an accuracy equal to the width of a single hydrogen atom.

White holes, reverse of black holes, are regions of spacetime that cannot be entered from outside although matter and light can escape from it.

We do not know any physical process of its formation but an incidence is documented as an inconclusive evidence of its existence.

Mongols, infamous for mass slaughter of cities, believed in flourish through trade.

They made trade on Silk Route so secure that it was said that a man could walk from one end to another, with a gold plate on his head, without having any fear of being robbed.

Table tennis was played with champagne corks and was called whiff-whaff, but then celluloid balls were used and it got renamed to ping-pong, on sound balls made when hit.

Ping-pong was trademarked by a British manufacturer forcing others to use a generic term Table Tennis.

Psychologically losses are twice as powerful as gains - Loss of 50 is equivalent to gain of 100.

We have developed a tendency to avert losses. This explains why we prefer to purchase a higher priced product "shipping included" than a lower priced with "shipping extra".

Every object emits a thermal radiation whose spectrum depends on the temperature of the object - Black Body Radiation.

This is why some objects glow red when hot while some emits white. We glow too, but we are too cool to emit visible light - we glow infra red.

Babylonian mathematics was a sexagesimal - base 60. From this we derive 60 sec in a minute and 360 deg in a circle.

60 was picked because it is highly composite and divisible by 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 10, 12, 15, 20, 30, 60 making calculations and working with fractions easy.

Where did the Moon come from?

4.5 billion years ago a Mars-sized ancient protoplanet, named Theia, collided head-on with early Earth. The debris formed after the collision gathered around and coalesced into an early Moon.

One of the earliest murder committed by Genghis Khan was of his half brother Bekter, when Genghis was just 10-14 years old.

Bekter was as the eldest male in the family and would eventually had the right to claim Hoelun, Genghis' mother, as wife.

The Spanish word for Cockroach is "cucaracha" which means "kind of beetle" and was borrowed in English in 1620s.

Some non-spanish speaker thought cucaracha was misspelling of other animal names Cock (chicken) and Roach (fish) and hence they "fixed" it to Cockroach.

An airplane, on average, is struck by lightning once every 3000 hours but it is safe from harm.

When lightning hits the plane, the electricity passes through the conductive outer shell of the aircraft and is released into the atmosphere through the static dischargers.

Every particle has an anti-particle - same mass, opposite electric charge, some difference in quantum numbers. When they collide energy proportional to E = mc^2 is released.

Antimatter particles bind with one another to form antimatter. We have artificially baked Antihydrogen and Antihelium in laboratories.

positron + antiproton = antihydrogen

Prime numbers that differ by 6 are called Sexy Primes

Pairs: (5, 11) ...
Triplets: (67, 73, 79) ...
Quadruplets: (41, 47, 53, 59) ...
Quintuplet: (5, 11, 17, 23, 29)

There are many pairs, triplets and quadruplets but the above quintuplet is the only one that could exist.

Within galaxies stars stay in place because of gravity. Observed gravitational forces aren't strong enough to hold them together.

There is extra gravitational force exerted from the stuff we cannot observe - Dark Matter - and it makes up 27% of our entire universe while the regular matter is only 5%.

If there was no dark matter - stars would have flung out of the galaxies.

In Ancient Roman Empire, some wealthy families used to circulate fresh cold water, from the upstream, in their houses.

The water was circulated through the internal pipe fittings and the movement or flow of water was facilitated through gravity alone.

Old English did not have a past tense for "go".

There was a verb "wend" (synonym of go) meaning "go in a specific direction". Because of direction it had, "went" was a perfect past tense for both words.

It's also why we have bad/worse, good/better, and be/am.

Shrimp's heart is located very near to its head.

The cephalic portion (the head) of the Shrimp is covered with a thick substances which provides extra protection to the internal organs beneath it. Evolution made the heart move north, near its head.

Mendeleev while creating periodic table, accurately predicted existence & properties of 4 elements.

For provisional naming, he used prefixes eka, dvi and tri (from Sanskrit) depending upon the position from a known element

Ex: Germanium was eka-silicon till 1886.

Graham's number is one of the biggest finite number to have been conceived as a solution to a mathematical riddle.

The number is so enormous that we cannot use our standard form to express it. It is denoted by g64 and is given by a recursive definition.

Europa, a moon of Jupiter, has the smoothest surface of any known solid object in the Solar System.

It lacks big mountains and craters; and has an icy crust with water beneath it. The atmosphere is mostly oxygen making it a suitable place for human habitation.

The wars between Romans and Persians lasted about 681 years, 92 BC â€“ 627 AD.

It is the third longest conflict in human history.

The word Blackmail comes from combination of word "black", representing evil, and an obsolete word "mail" meaning tribute or rent or payment (around 16th century).

PS: mail has nothing to do with mail as in letters.

Some baby turtles talk to each other while they are still in their eggs so that they all hatch together, likely as a survival mechanism.

Communication happens using about 300 different types of sounds.

Electrons sometimes exist inside the nucleus.

Phenomenon is called Quantum Tunneling - where a subatomic particle crosses a potential barrier and continues exists on the other side.

This is not as rare as it sounds, Nuclear Fusion in stars happens due to this.

Solving 1/998001 will generate all the three digit numbers from 000 to 999 = 0.000 001 002 003 .... 998 999 000 001 002 ...
 
Neatly explained by the power series expansion 

1/(1-x)^2 = 1 + 2x + 3x^2 + 4x^3 + ...
when |x| < 1

substitute: x = 1/1000

Europa, one of the 79 known moons of Jupiter, was discovered by Galileo in 1610.

It was the first moon to have been be discovered after our own moon.

Prior 480 BC, Greeks were divided and identified by their city-states ex Spartans and Athenians

When a Persian King named Xerxes led an invasion on Athens, other city-states chipped in with the help. Post the victory, Greeks started to see themselves as Greeks.

Word Veterinarian was taken from a Latin word "veterinarius" which means "one who works with animals".

Over time, the definition got widened to "animal doctor" in general. The animal doctor prior to Veterinarian was, bizarrely, called a dog-leech.

Oysters make pearls as a defensive response to foreign objects.

Once sand/parasite is inside, the oyster begins to deposit Nacre (mainly calcium carbonate) on it. To glue layers of Nacre, oyster coats it with Conchiolin, which gives pearls its shiny and glossy look.

Mass of an atom is always less than the sum total of the masses of its sub-atomic particles.

The difference in mass is radiated off as energy helping bind the nucleus together and is governed by the famous E = mc^2

Ramanujan was once ill and his colleague G H Hardy visited him and said that taxi he came by had a dull number 1729 to which Rama instantly replied

"It is the smallest number expressible as the sum of two cubes in two different ways"

FYI: (1, 12) and (9, 10)

One way to signal aliens about our existence is to create a giant sail, about size of a planet with having some unnatural shape like a triangle, orbiting the Sun

Observing this unnatural shape while analyzing the light from Sun, aliens would guess our existence

Ancient Greece nurtured intellectuals and witnessed the rise of path-breaking poets, mathematicians, architects, writers and philosophers.

It also introduced the idea of Democracy and gave us the vocabulary for talking about Politics.

The word Mosquito has been borrowed from Old Spanish word Mosca inspired from the Sanskrit word à¤®à¤¶à¤• meaning Fly (à¤®à¤•à¥à¤–à¥€)

Poor Mosquitos - we have been calling them Fly all of our lives.

Mayans believed that world was going to end on 21st December 2012 because it marked the start of the new Baktun (a long unit of time as per Mayans) making the date flipped to 13.0.0.0.0 as per Mayan Calendar.

An invisibility cloak, similar to Harry Potters', could be build using Metamaterials.

Metamaterials have a negative index of refraction and hence render an object invisible by directing the propagation of light around the object.

1 Googol = 10^100
1 Googolplex = 10^googol

Googolplex is such a gigantic number that if we were to write 1 digit of it on a particle and second digit on another, for all particles of our entire universe, we would still be unable to complete the number.

For us the Sun and the Moon seems to have same size because the sun is roughly 400 times larger than the moon but is roughly 400 times farther away.

Thatâ€™s why we on Earth can sometimes witness a total eclipse of the sun.

Kingdoms conquered by Persians were allowed to keep their kings and elites as long as they pledged allegiance to the Persian king and paid taxes.

Persians in return provided better roads and infrastructure. One could say they ruled with a light touch.

Ampersand (&) was once the 27th letter of the alphabet and it appeared right at the end and alphabet song ended like

w, x, y, z and per se &

"per se" used to distinguish letter that could be word and over time words "and per se and" were slurred to ampersand.

In Chess, the fewest possible number of moves to checkmate the opponent, from the start of the game, is 2.

The move is called the Fool's mate and only Black could win with this move.

Even though smaller animals/insects ðŸ require less amount of energy, the larger animals ðŸ³ are far more efficient in using it.

According to Kleiber's law, the rate of energy expenditure (metabolic rate) is proportional mass of the animal, m^(3/4)

1 is divisible by 1 and itself, then why it is not a Prime number?

Historically it was a prime number but later it was dropped because if not, it took away generality from theorems and mathematicians had to add "all primes except 1" to most of the theorems.

Atmosphere & surface composition of an exoplanet is identified by

 - isolating Planet's light from its star
 - running spectroscopy

Every element absorbs a specific band light and hence analyzing the absorption helps us find what lies on and in the planet.

Cyrus the Great founded the first Persian Empire in 550 B.C. The empire was the worldâ€™s first superpower.

It united the three important sites of early human civilization: Mesopotamia, Egyptâ€™s Nile Valley and Indiaâ€™s Indus Valley, under one government.

Chameleon = khamai (on the ground) + leon (lion) making it, literally, the lion of the ground.

Akkadians, an ancient culture (2000bc) called this lizard "nes qaqqari" literally "lion of the ground," and this was picked up unaltered by Greek and then by Latin.

Bears ðŸ» do not urinate while they hibernate.

Their bodies breaks down urine to build protein and use it as food to maintain muscle ðŸ’ª and organ tissues during the long sleep.

24 elements of our periodic table have been brewed in Nuclear reactors â˜¢ï¸ some of which do not even occur naturally.

Half of synthetic elements are used in creating explosives and almost all Actinides, the last row of our periodic table, are synthetic.

Length of A size papers (A4/A3/A5 etc) is square root 2 times the breadth ðŸ“°

With this ratio the paper could be folded in half and doubled without losing its proportions as the original and Square root of 2 is the only ratio for which this holds true.

Habitable exoplanets are just planets that are in "habitable zone" - the region near a star where water stays in liquid form.

There is no way for us to know if the planet is actually suitable for Humans or not. The only true habitable planet we know is Earth ðŸŒ

Ancient Egyptians had two forms for writings

 - hieroglyphic: used for everything sacred and religious literature
 - demotic: used for general systems

The hieroglyphic script was pictorial/logographic and alphabetic, and contained about 900 distinct signs.

Neighbour comes from amalgamation of two words of Old English

 - nÄ“ah which means near, and
 - gebÅ«r which means inhabitant, farmer

Hence: Neighbour is a farmer/inhabitant that lives nearby.

The first published book ðŸ“• ever to contain photographs was called British Algae, and as the name suggests it contained a lot of photographs of algae.

The book as published in 1843 and the author was Anna Atkins, an English botanist ðŸŒ¿ and photographer ðŸ“·

In space, where there is nothing to push against, Rocket ðŸš€ uses Conservation of Momentum to gain thrust and move forward faster.

To keep net momentum of the system constant, when the gases are ejected backwards, the forward momentum is gained by the rocket.

The minimum number of initial clues required to solve a Sudoku ðŸ”¢ uniquely is 17.

This was proved in 2013 by Gary McGuire and the proof, in a way, examined all possible 16-clue grids and verified that none of them has a unique solution.

Black holes âš«ï¸ evaporate due to Hawking Radiation âš¡ï¸

During "evaporation" a black hole loses mass and energy. It is such a staggeringly slow process that It would take about 10^67 years for a black hole the mass of the Sun to evaporate completely.

Early Egyptian pyramids were built to please Pharaoh, monarchs ðŸ’º

Pharaoh were intermediary between the gods and the people and it was believed that they became Gods upon their death and hence people spend their entire lives pleasing them.

Goodbye ðŸ‘‹ is a contraction of "God be with ye"

The phrase "God be with ye" got shorter and shorter, and eventually it became Godby; which then became Goodbye. The change of God to Good was due to confusion with expressions like Good Morning, Good Evening, etc.

Sharks ðŸ¦ˆ are older than trees ðŸŒ²

The earliest species that we could classify as "tree" lived around 350 million years ago while Sharks have been around for 400 million years.

The magnetic field ðŸ§² of Earth is generated as a combination of Earth's rotation about its axis and the electric currents created due to the motion of molten iron ðŸ”¥ in the the outer core.

Earth thus becomes a Dynamo creating magnetic field around the planet.

3435 is the only finite number in base 10, which is the sum of its digits raised to the power of itself.

3435 = 3^3 + 4^4 + 3^3 + 5^5

This number is called as Munchausen number, based on a fictional German nobleman who was super narcissistic.

Our entire universe is filled with a faint uniform radiation, remnant from an early stage of universe, called Cosmic microwave background

In old TV sets ðŸ“º that worked with an antenna, the sizeable amount of black and white dot screen was due to this radiation

Ancient Egyptians developed Basin irrigation to make best use of Nile ðŸŒŠ and get huge ðŸŒ½ surplus.

During floods, the water would be trapped in basins. Once the soil was full, the water that remained was drained to another basin through a network of drains.

Democracy comes from amalgamation of 2 Greek words dÄ“mos (the common people) and -kratia (rule/strength/power)

It first appeared in the ancient Greek in the city-state of Athens, which is also the first known democracy of the world - around 6th century BC.

The middle finger ðŸ–• has been used as a derogatory gesture for at least 2800 years.

The gesture dates back to ancient Greece and Rome. In those times it was used as a symbol of sexual intercourse, in a manner meant to degrade, intimidate and threaten.

Batteries ðŸ”‹ are very similar to water tank - more filled they are, more flow you would see1.5V battery may be 1.6V when full and 1.2V when almost empty; knowing the output voltage, device looks up how much is energy usually left and then shows it.

Kepler-16b is a planet that orbits not one, but two stars â˜€ï¸ and because of this you will always cast two shadows on that planet.

In a poetic way it is said that Kepler-16b is a place "Where your shadow always has company".
In ancient Roman tradition, women ðŸ‘§ were supposed to have given up their hair to be used as elastic rope in catapults and it made weapons highly effective and efficient.

The word Idea ðŸ’¡ comes from Greek word "Idein" which means "to see", later started to be used for the word "pattern" and then was adopted in Latin as Idea, as we know it.

If we think about it, the "idea" is actually foreseeing a pattern ðŸ¤”
In Japanese, the word for "wrist" is "æ‰‹é¦–" (tekubi) which is literally "hand neck" and for ankle is "è¶³é¦–"ï¼ˆashikubi) which translates to "foot neck".

Sun's â˜€ï¸ magnetic field flips its polarity, completely, approximately every 11 years - this phenomenon is called Solar Cycle.

Hence unlike Earth, Sun's magnetic north ðŸ§² is not always in its northern hemisphere.

The world of numbers define friendship in terms of Amicable Numbers, which are pairs of integers, such that each number equals to the sum of the divisors of the other, eg. 220 and 284, making two numbers alike.

Sum of divisors of 220 is 284 and 284 is 220.

Panspermia is a hypothesis that supports that the life on Earth ðŸŒ could have come from the outer space as an intended or unintended contamination by microorganisms ðŸ¦  carried on asteroid, comet â˜„ï¸ or even space ship ðŸ›¸ more like inter galactic pollination.
The earliest known example of a named person in writing is "Kushim" - who was an accountant from Mesopotamia around 3200 B.C.
Porcupine comes from a combination of two latin words Porcus and Spina which mean "Pig Thorn" ðŸ·
A specie of Wolves became tamer companions and evolved into dogs ðŸ¶ about 27,000 years ago.

Higgs Field is the reason things have mass.

Every elementary particle interacts with this field. More a particle (eg: Electron, Quark, etc) interacts heavier it gets.

Electron interacts the least hence lightest; Photon does not interact at all hence zero mass.

There are galaxies receding away ðŸ’« from us at more than a speed of light because of expansion of Space ðŸ© in between.

Thus there will be galaxies light from whose would never reach us no matter how far we went, making them non existent to us.

In ancient Egypt, the soil around Nile ðŸŒŠ was so fertile and rich that people would just toss seeds on the ground and let their cattle ðŸ„ walk on them.

Due to weight of the cattle, the seed was pressed into the ground and then after few days plants ðŸŒ½ sprouted.

The word Hazard comes from an arabic word al-zahr (the dice) ðŸŽ²

French picked the word as hasart meaning the Game of Dice. As the games were mostly gambling, the sentiment of risk got associated with the word, which was then eventually adopted as Hazard.

Just Room Enough Island is the smallest inhabited island ðŸï¸

The total area of the Island is mere 3,300 square feet. The island was purchased by Sizeland family in the 1950s and holds a house, a tree, shrubs, and a small beach; hence the name Just Room Enough

Stronger Magnetic ðŸ§² force near its poles - Why?

Every force field is a distribution of particles called Virtual Particles. Field strength is proportional to number of these particles.

Near poles the density is higher and it drops exponentially with distance.

Perfect number is a positive integers that is equal to sum of all its proper divisors.

Ex: 6 = 1 + 2 + 3

These are so rare that, as of Dec 2018, we only know 51 perfect numbers; all of them are even and largest one has about 50 million (49,724,095) digits.

Cosmological Redshift is observed when wavelength of light ðŸ•¯ï¸ is stretched due to expansion of space through which it is traveling; this makes the light from distant galaxies ðŸ“º redder and proves the expansion of our universe.
In early Mesopotamian cities farmers ðŸ‘¨â€ðŸŒ¾ contributed their crops ðŸŒ½ to public storehouses out of which workers of the entire city would be paid uniform "wages" in grains.

Clue is derived from the word "clew" meaning Ball of yarn ðŸ in Greek.

In Greek mythology, Clew, a ball of yarn, was used by Theseus to find his way out of a labyrinth ðŸ§© Because of this, the word "clew" came to mean something that points the way.

Beavers build dams to protect ðŸ›¡ï¸ themselves against predators and to provide easy access to food ðŸŽ during winter.

The biggest dam built by beavers is staggering 2790ft long.
Tungsten has the highest melting point ðŸ”¥ of any pure element, melting at 3700K, and hence, as we know, it is used to light Electric Bulbs ðŸ’¡

16 is the only number that could be represented with 2 distinct integers (x,y) as x^y = y^x ðŸ¤¯

There are infinitely many solutions to above equation in rational numbers.

Jupiter does not revolve around the Sun ðŸŒž

Jupiter ðŸŒ is so huge and massive that both the Sun and the Jupiter revolves around their common center of mass, called barycenter, which is slightly outside the Sun's surface.

People in Indus Valley Civilization ðŸ§‘ðŸ‘© were peaceful, and this was inferred from the fact that archeologist found 1500 sites ðŸ˜ï¸ spanning this civilization but almost zero evidence of warfare and almost no weapons ðŸ—¡ï¸

Whiskey ðŸ¸ is the short form of Whiskeybae.

Whiskeybae comes from the Old English word usquebae, derived from two Gaelic (a Celtic language) words - uisce (water) and bethu (life), literally translating Whiskey to "water of life"
St Lucia is the only country in the world named after a historical woman - Saint Lucy of Syracuse ðŸ‘©

Water ðŸŒŠ is an example of Newtonian Fluid which means the viscosity stays constant under pressure ðŸ‹ï¸â€â™€ï¸ There are fluids that do not obey this and are called Non-Newtonian Fluids.

Ex: Ketchup ðŸ… is very viscous at rest but becomes runnier when shaken.

If you keep on adding digits of a number that is a multiple of 9 (greater than 0), and keep on doing it until you are left with a single digit.

The single digit that you will have at last will always be 9 ðŸ¤¯

Our Universe ðŸŒŸ is expanding at an enormous rate but it does not have any center of expansion.

Expansion rate is same at every single point. This was beautifully explained in 1929 by Edwin Hubble. This expansion is very similar to how cake ðŸ¥ž rises in an oven.

Ironically early civilizations ðŸ‘©â€ðŸŒ¾ like Indus Valley Civilization, prospered due to floods.

Floods ðŸŒŠ were responsible for depositing nutrient rich silt to the banks of the river making soil â›°ï¸ very fertile and a perfect place for the crops ðŸŒ¿ to take roots.

The word "Assassin" ðŸ¤º is a result of centuries of mispronunciation of the word "hashishiyyin" which is the name of a fanatical Muslim sect. The sect during the Crusades smoked hashish and then murdered leaders on the opposing side âš”ï¸
A pumping human heart â¤ï¸ can squirt blood 30ft
Litmus, from the Litmus test ðŸ”´ ðŸ”µ is a actually a water-soluble mixture of different dyes extracted from lichens (symbiotic association between a fungus and an alga).

Squaring the circle is the problem, proposed by ancient Geometers, of constructing a square â¹ï¸ with the same area as a given circle âš«ï¸ In 1882 this task was proven to be impossible, as a consequence proved that pi (Ï€) is a transcendental number.
Uranus was the first planet ðŸŒ that was discovered with a telescope ðŸ”­

Barbarian, currently used for Uncivilized or primitive ðŸ‘º, was actually used by Ancient Greek to refer to people who did not speak Ancient Greek, because to them all other languages sounded like Bar Bar Bar Bar Bar, gibberish.

Now that is some stereotyping.

The trigonometric function, sine, has a really interesting etymology.

It started from India, through Sanskrit word for Chord, Jya, then transliterated tin Arabic as Jiba, Jb and Jaib, which means Breast, then translated into Latin as Sinus, and then to sine.

You see objects ðŸš— when the light ðŸ”¦ reflected from it reaches your eye. But you understand this light  (encoded in electric signals) when it reaches your brain ðŸ§ 

This process of understanding light signals takes about 0.15-0.2 seconds â²ï¸

How Ozone absorbs UV rays? â˜€ï¸

UV rays hits Oxygen and splits it into 2 Oxygen atoms. Oxygen atom then combines with Oxygen molecule to form Ozone. When UV hits this Ozone it splits it into 1 atom and 1 Oxygen molecule. This continuous cycle thus absorbs â˜ ï¸ UV

Why is Area of triangle ðŸ“ is (b*h)/2?

Take 2 right angled triangles and form a rectangle with it. Area of this rectangle is (b*h). The area of triangle is half of it, equaling (b*h)/2.

For other triangles, slice them into right angled ones and add.

One day on Venus is longer than its one year ðŸŒ

Venus takes 224.7 Earth days to orbit it around the sun but it takes 243 Earth days to complete one rotation.

The life of Foragers, 15000 years ago, was not nasty as we think, rather they spent less time working, and more on Art ðŸ–¼ï¸ Music ðŸŽ¶ and Storytelling ðŸ§“

This was found by studying fossil remains; their bones and teeth were healthier than agriculturists ðŸŽ

Where did the word "rice" come from?

rice => French ris => Italian riso => Latin oriza => Greek oryza => Pashto vriÅ¾e => Sanskrit vrihi-s à¤µà¥à¤°à¥€à¤¹à¤¿ ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡³

There exists Half QWERTY keyboards designed for mobile phones ðŸ“± where 2 characters (ex: Q and W) share the same key.

Nokia ðŸ¤ was one of the most popular brand to have adopted this keyboard layout, for its E55 model.

The Doppler Effect is the change in frequency/wavelength ðŸ”Š of a wave in relation to observer, moving relative to wave source.

This phenomenon is so prolific that it finds its application in radars, sonography, and even in finding exoplanets ðŸŒ
The theorem we now know as Pythagorean theorem ðŸ“ was described first by a mathematician/priest named BaudhÄyana in BaudhÄyana ÅšulbasÃ»tra - a group of Sanskrit texts âœï¸ back in 8th century BCE.

We always see the same face of the Moon ðŸŒ™

This happens due to a special case of Tidal Locking, synchronous rotation - a situation when object's orbital period matches its rotational period.

Moon takes 28 days to orbit Earth ðŸŒŽ and rotate around its axis.

Roughly 15000 years ago, humans were hunters ðŸ—¡ï¸ and gatherers ðŸŽ and they mostly fished ðŸŸ and because of this the most populated places in early history were near the shores ðŸŒŠ

Fishing was also preferred because it was unlikely to attack and kill ðŸ’€
The word robot ðŸ¤– comes from the Czech word robota which means "forced labor".
Public transport ðŸšŒ is entirely free for residents of the Estonian capital, Tallinn ðŸ¤¯

Astrology â˜€ï¸ Feng Shui - Vaastu Shastra ðŸ  Acupuncture ðŸ“Œ Graphology âœï¸ Palmistry âœ‹ and many more, are claimed to be sciences, but in fact these are Pseudosciences ðŸ‘» they are incompatible with our scientific methods for accepting something as science.
The prime numbers that end in 2 and 5 are in fact 2 and 5 ðŸ¤¯

We still do not know how planets are formed? ðŸ¤”
One hypothesis - Tidal Downsizing

clump of gas ðŸŒ€ abt 10 Jupiters, condenses due to gravity, solid grains collide and settle, grows into massive core ðŸ—¿ clump disrupted due to Tidal Forces leaving behind a planet ðŸŒŽ
Roman numerals does not have a ZERO instead they used the word "nulla" (meaning none in Latin) ðŸ¤¯ whenever they wanted to represent 0.

The Pythagorean Theorem holds true not only for 2 dimensional triangles but also for higher dimensional solids, like cuboids, and even for non-euclidean spacesðŸ¤¯
